ygData.subject: Re: possible big cheat for EQ....
ygData.msgSnippet: ... ssh encrypt fast ethernet traffic using DES, MD5, Blowfish, and some other algorithms just fine ... and you can even compress all the data going thru the
ygData.messageBody:
Dmitry M. Devishev wrote:

> From: "Dmitry M. Devishev" <dmitry@...>
>
> Hi!

> Second, good crypting is very
> time-consuming, and EQ server have traffic around 1MB/sec. It is
> impossible to encrypt 1MB per second with any serious algorithm.

ssh encrypt fast ethernet traffic using DES, MD5, Blowfish, and some other
algorithms just fine ... and you can even compress all the data going thru the
tunnel AND it uses little CPU, like... less than 1%

Here in Brazil we have a whole IRC network using ssh tunneling between
all the servers.. this network have like 30K users and 70 servers... ssh runs
smooth and we are compressing all the data which decreased the network
lag drastically.

BUT Its not even close to a solution to EQ...
EQ dont have any problems with this kind of stuff (yet)... so why bother ?

BTW, if Verant for some reason decide to use encrypted connections
(which would be a stupid idea) they could use any 64bit algorithm AFAIK
its ok... they woudnt need any kind of permission from governament.

Anyway the best solution for them would be any kind of CRC... I think
they probably use it already =P
